quotes: Focus is a skill you can train—patience is the best mentor.
Every act of creation begins in stillness; slow your mind first.
Capture ideas the moment they appear and procrastination loses ground.
Stay aware of the present and time will feel more substantial.
When you commit wholeheartedly, the world makes room for you.

pomodoro.title: Focus for 25 minutes, rest for 5, keep your rhythm sharp
pomodoro.description: Adapted from astroud/pomodoro-react-app with custom durations, round tracking, chimes, and quick skip—perfect for deep-work sprints.

long.label: Long break
long.hint: Default 15 minutes after every four cycles.

guideItems: After each focus block the timer switches to a short break automatically.
Every four focus blocks trigger a long break to recharge.
A soft chime plays at the end—headphones or a cue light work great.

todo.title: A lightweight todo list with priorities and status filters
todo.description: Inspired by taniarascia/todo. Everything stores locally, works offline, and helps you triage effort levels.
tips: Tasks save to local storage automatically, so you can refresh without worry.
Use High / Normal / Relaxed priorities to complement your pomodoro or daily plan.
Filters keep the board tidy by separating active and completed work.

whiteNoise.title: Layer ambient sounds to build an immersive focus zone
whiteNoise.description: Inspired by SoundDrown. Uses the browser Audio API so you can mix tracks independently—great for writing, reading, meditation, or winding down.
tips: Blend two or three tracks and balance their volume for depth.
Use “Stop all” to reset timelines instantly when switching scenes.
Default volume is 60%; tap “Reset volume” to snap back anytime.

inhale.label: Inhale
inhale.hint: Draw in slowly through the nose; let chest and belly rise like treetops.

hold.label: Hold
hold.hint: Hold gently and feel the breath settle inside.

exhale.label: Exhale
exhale.hint: Release like wind through a forest, carrying tension away.

quotes: Breath is the bridge between yourself and the world.
Let thoughts disperse like morning mist, leaving clear awareness.
Sit quietly and listen—your body is always speaking.
Treat every breath with kindness and calm arrives naturally.
Light and shadow drift through the woods like the rhythm of your heart.
